a10.asvr.db.core module¶

a10.asvr.db.core.addClaim(e)¶

Adds an entry to the elements collection.

First this outputs the element as JSON and then tries to insert it into the database. MongoDB returns an inserted_id - which is a mongo ObjectID - if this is successful.

Parameters:e (dict) – the element to be added
Returns:the success or failure of the operation
Return type:Bool

a10.asvr.db.core.getLatestLogEntries(n)¶

Params int n:number of entries to return
Returns:list of log entries
Return type:list dict
a10.asvr.db.core.getLatestResults(e, n)¶
Returns the latest n results for a given element sorted by verifiedAt.
We let the underlying database to do the sorting for efficiency reasons.
Parameters:
  • e (str) – ItemID of the element
  • n (int) – Maximum number of items to return, defaults to 10
Returns:

the list of results
Return type:

list dict or None
a10.asvr.db.core.getLatestResultsForElementAndPolicy(e, p, n)¶
Returns the latest n results for a given element sorted by verifiedAt.
We let the underlying database to do the sorting for efficiency reasons.
Parameters:
  • e (str) – ItemID of the element
  • p (str) – ItemID of the policy
  • n (int) – Maximum number of items to return, defaults to 10
Returns:

the list of results
Return type:

list dict or None
